input: Not able to follow-up discharged kids
discharged
discharge
Can I understand why on dashboard I have 5 children who are indicated as discharged yet they are still with us
responses: Sometimes there is a delay in the status upgrade but we will check it up

For a case to 'disappear from pending' as you put it,you must have provided at least one service by managing encounters.If you don't manage any encounter but you manage a service,referral or court session,it still remains pending. So,there is a great chance that in some cases you have not managed an encounter hence them remaining as pending.

input: why is date of next mention inactive for future dates inactive in the management for court sessions
responses: It's not possible to confirm all cases esp far court, orderlies/ police escort are frequently changed you can't keep track. A workable solution would be in order

input: CPIMS seems to be very slow today Kuna issue
I am unable to register new child data. It's hanging. Your assistance please.
Why is my internet so slow?
Can you help me troubleshoot my slow internet?
What could be causing my slow internet?
How can I speed up my internet connection?
My internet is crawling, can you help?
Why am I experiencing slow internet speeds?
Is there an issue with my internet connection?
What can I do to improve my slow internet?
Could you check if there's an issue with my internet speed?
My internet is barely functioning, can you assist me?
What could be causing my internet to be sluggish?
Can you run a speed test on my internet connection?
Is there anything wrong with my internet speed?
Why is my internet running so slowly all of a sudden?
How can I fix my slow internet?
Can you help me improve my internet speed?
Why is my internet so sluggish?
What's causing my internet to be so slow?
Could you investigate why my internet is slow?
What are some ways I can speed up my internet?
Can you check if there's any maintenance happening on the network?
Is there a way to troubleshoot my internet speed?
My internet is painfully slow, what can I do?
What can be done to increase my internet speed?
Why am I not getting the internet speed I'm paying for?
Can you recommend any tips to improve my internet speed?
How can I get better internet performance?
What might be the reason for my slow internet?
Is there a problem with my internet connection?
Why is my internet taking so long to load web pages?
responses: From the system side there is no problem and could be a network issue.
Kindly Check your internet, CPIMS is working
Kindly restart your machine
Try refreshing your browser
kindly log out and try logging in again
Kindly check your internet connection, CPIMS is working fine on our end. It could be an issue with your internet service provider.
Kindly restart your machine and see if that improves your internet speed. It could be an issue with your computer's settings or memory usage.
Try refreshing your browser and clearing your cache. This could help improve your internet speed.
Kindly log out of CPIMS and try logging in again. This could help refresh the connection and improve your internet speed.
It's possible that there's a temporary outage in your area. Check the outage map to see if that's the case.
Your internet connection may be slow due to heavy traffic on the network. Check the network status to see if that's the issue.
Sometimes, antivirus or firewall software can slow down your internet speed. Check your security settings to see if that's the issue.
You may want to try using a different web browser or updating your current browser to improve your internet speed.
Have you recently installed any new software or made any changes to your computer settings? This could be impacting your internet speed.
There may be a problem with your modem or router. Troubleshoot those devices to see if that's the issue.
You may want to consider upgrading your internet plan to get faster speeds. Check your options.
Sometimes, running too many applications at once can slow down your internet speed. Check your task manager to see if that's the issue.
Sometimes, your internet service provider may be experiencing issues. Check with them to see if there's a problem.
Your internet connection may be affected by the distance between your device and the router. Check the signal strength and placement of your devices.
There may be too many devices connected to your network, causing slow speeds. Try disconnecting some devices to see if that helps.
You may want to try using a wired connection instead of a  wireless connection to improve your internet speed.
Your internet speed may be impacted by the number of devices connected to your network. Check how many devices are currently connected.
You may want to try disabling any browser extensions or add-ons to see if that improves your internet speed.

responses: Use the forgot password functionality to reset.

Step 1: Go to reset password link from login page or directly from here https://childprotection.go.ke/accounts/password/reset/
  Step 2: Enter you email address and a link will be sent to the email
  Step 3: Click on the link in the email to reset password
  Step 4: Enter new password and repeat it and click submit (This will NEVER ask you for your old password and if it does then it means you are already logged in to CPIMS)
  Step 5: Log in with your new password in Step 4 and if it requests after log in to change password then your old password will be the one in Step 4.

Please try logging in from another machine and report if it works. You can even use your phone. www.childprotection.go.ke is up and running. Please confirm that your internet connection is active and try to logging in from another computer.
use the forgot password functionality
Hello kindly clear history n caches of your browser or you can use another recommended browser
Kindly use the CPIMS reset password reset link is located on the login page just after the submit button or you can click on this link: https://childprotection.go.ke/accounts/password/reset/
Go to forgot password enter your email then instructions will be sent to your email.

Sign in and provide an email address during registration of your account to self reset your password. Just go to forgot password then enter your email address. Instructions will be sent to your email. Just follow them and you will be able to activate your account.

First you start by login to the system. You put your username and password as 1234.Click log in. The system will prompt you to enter old password put old password as1234 and finally create a new password using a combination of at least 8 characters, capital letter, small letters and special characters ($,@,?,&).
If you're having trouble accessing your account, you can also contact the CPIMS help desk for further assistance.
Please ensure that you're entering the correct username and password. If you're still unable to access your account, try resetting your password using the reset link or the forgot password option.
If you've recently changed your password and are still unable to access your account, please try clearing your browser's cache and cookies and then attempt to log in again.
If you're unable to reset your password using the provided link, please contact the CPIMS help desk for further assistance.
Please ensure that you've provided a valid email address during the registration process, as this will be required for password reset.
If you're unable to locate the reset password link on the login page, please contact the CPIMS help desk for further assistance.
If you're having trouble creating a new password, please ensure that you're following the password requirements provided by the system.
If you're still unable to activate your account after following the provided instructions, please contact the CPIMS help desk for further assistance.
Please ensure that you're using a secure network connection when attempting to access your account.
If you suspect that your account has been compromised, please contact the CPIMS help desk immediately for further assistance.

input: What should I do if I'm unable to access the CPIMS system due to a computer crash?
Are there any warning signs that my computer might be about to crash, and how can I recognize them?
Can you provide any troubleshooting tips for fixing a computer that has crashed
What should I do if my computer crashes while I'm using the CPIMS system
crash
system crashed
lag
system
is slow
responses: if your computer has crashed and you need technical assistance, I recommend reaching out to your organization's IT support team or contacting a professional computer repair service. They should be able to assist you with resolving the issue and getting your computer back up and running.
Contact the IT team for assistance

If your computer crashes while using the CPIMS system, try restarting your computer and reopening the CPIMS system. If the issue persists, contact the organization's IT support team for further assistance.

To prevent your computer from crashing while using the CPIMS system, make sure that your computer meets the system requirements for the software and keep your computer's operating system and antivirus software up-to-date. Additionally, avoid running too many programs or tasks simultaneously as this can strain your computer's resources

If your computer has crashed, try restarting it and running a virus scan to check for any malware or viruses that may be causing the issue. If the issue persists, contact your organization's IT support team for further assistance.

Depending on the cause of the computer crash, you may or may not lose data or information stored in the CPIMS system. It is always a good idea to regularly backup your data to prevent data loss in the event of a computer crash

input: transfer a child to a different institution
transfer
Hi,I need advice from team leaders here, when you discharge child from institution should it automatically reduce in pending cases on dashboard?

What I mean is when I discharge some children from institution some disappear from pending cases on dashboard while others remain despite showing successfully discharged from institution, what could be reason? please experts advice
What would be the problem the children am placing do not appear at the dashboard
responses:
1. Institution population appears on the dashboard (Boys/Girls) 
 2. To Search for a child just use the search bar appearing on all pages at the top put child name and click enter. 
  3. In child search results there is a history button to give child past CPIMS interactions (past cases, institution placements and any program enrollments like USAID OVC program, PSSB)
 4. In case record detail and institution details (Edit, Print, pdf) has been added. The print button is now functional. 
 5. when your password is changed you will recieve a CPIMS internal notification.
  6. When you transfer a child to another insitituion the users in the other SI will be notified.
 
 TO DO 
1. All notification are CPIMS internal and we are working on email and SMS if possible.
 2. To work on your feedback

For a case to 'disappear from pending' as you put it,you must have provided at least one service by managing encounters.If you don't manage any encounter but you manage a service,referral or court session,it still remains pending. So,there is a great chance that in some cases you have not managed an encounter hence them remaining as pending.
